message.item.redstone_panel:
§7Panel to hold tiny components.
Right click with dye to change color.§r
message.item.redstone_wrench:
§7Right-click a Redstone Panel to rotate.
Left click to remove tiny components.
Shift-left click to remove all of them.§r
message.item.redstone_panel_cell: Can be placed on a Redstone Panel or in-world to form a redstone circuit.
message.item.tiny_color_selector:
§7Right click on a tiny block to select its color.
Works with most cube shaped components.§r
message.item.blueprint.full:
§7Right click to place this circuit on a panel or in world.
Right click the air to export to a JSON file.

§dRequires the following:§r
message.item.blueprint.empty:
§7Right click a circuit to save to this blueprint.
Right Click in air to import a circuit from a JSON file.§r
tinyredstone.gui.crash.msg:
This panel has crashed.
Please check your log file,
 and report crash to mod author if possible.
You can only remove components.
Click 'Restart' to attempt to re-enable panel.
tinyredstone.gui.overflow.msg:
A circuit on this panel has overflown.
A zero tick line of redstone may be too long.
Try adding a delay or increase the max
redstone length in the config.
Click 'Restart' to clear the error.
message.item.tinyredstone.tiny_redstone:
Transfers redstone signals similar to vanilla redstone dust.
Right click to select which sides to connect.
message.item.tinyredstone.tiny_repeater: Outputs a full (15) strong signal to the front when any signal is received at the back with a delay between 1 and 4 ticks set by right clicking.
message.item.tinyredstone.tiny_redstone_:
Can act as redstone power sources and a NOT gate.
Attaches to tiny blocks like vanilla torches, but it can angle away from you on the panel or on top of a block.
It is not necessary to place the torch against a block to create a NOT gate.
message.item.tinyredstone.tiny_comparato: Will pick up weak signals from adjacent blocks and inventory comparator outputs when placed on the edge of a panel.Right click to toggle subtract mode.
message.item.tinyredstone.tiny_piston:
Can push up to 12 tiny blocks.
It will push tiny blocks onto adjacent Redstone Panels, but it will not push off the panel if no adjacent Redstone Panel exists.
message.item.tinyredstone.tiny_sticky_pi: Same as Tiny Piston, but also pulls block back.
message.item.tinyredstone.tiny_solid_blo:
Behaves like a solid block with vanilla redstone.
It will carry a weak redstone signal when powered by redstone, and a strong signal when powered by a repeater or comparator.
Can be pushed by tiny pistons.
Use the Block Chopper to create Tiny Blocks with nearly any block texture.
message.item.tinyredstone.tiny_redstone_: Outputs full redstone power in all 6 directions and can be pushed by tiny pistons

Lights up when given a redstone signal.
Each lamp outputs a light value of 1 additively.
15 lit lamps will output the max light of 15.
message.item.tinyredstone.tiny_transpare:
Behaves like transparent blocks with vanilla redstone
Does not carry a redstone signal. Will allow signals to travel up, but not down.
Can be pushed by tiny pistons.
Use the Block Chopper to create Tiny Transparent Blocks with nearly any glass or translucent texture.
message.item.tinyredstone.tiny_button: Output redstone on all 4 sides and bottom for 15 ticks when activated.
message.item.tinyredstone.tiny_stone_but: Output redstone on all 4 sides and bottom for 10 ticks when activated.
message.item.tinyredstone.tiny_observer:
Outputs a pulse to the back whenever a change is detected in the cell or block in front of it.
When facing blocks out in the world, it behaves exactly like a vanilla observer.
When facing cells on the tile, it will detect movement, placement, removal and redstone changes.
Can be pushed by Tiny Pistons.
message.item.tinyredstone.tiny_super_rep:
Similar to Tiny Repeaters, except that when right clicked, a GUI will appear allowing you to set the delay from 0 to 100 redstone ticks (10 seconds) (configurable).
This component can act as a 0 tick diode or for a long delay clock circuit.
Very long lines may cause an overflow state. Limit is configurable.
message.item.tinyredstone.tiny_lever:
Outputs redstone on all 4 sides and bottom when on.
Right click to toggle on/off.
message.item.tinyredstone.tiny_redstone_:
Behaves like redstone dust except signals received on one side are only output to the opposite side.
This allows signals to cross over each other.
message.item.tinyredstone.light_panel_co:
Hides circuitry and prevents rendering.
Allows light to penetrate.
Use the Block Chopper to create a camouflage cover with nearly any texture.
message.item.tinyredstone.dark_panel_cov:
Hides circuitry and prevents rendering and client syncing.
Does not allow light to penetrate.
Use the Block Chopper to create a camouflage cover with nearly any texture.
message.item.tinyredstone.tiny_note_bloc:
Right click to change pitch. Right click with Tiny Component Wrench to select instrument.
Note is played on redstone pulse to Tiny Note Block or neighboring block (quasi-connectivity).
The One Probe and WAILA will display the instrument and note.
Can be pushed by Tiny Pistons.
message.item.tinyredstone.trim_panel_cov:
Trims circuit down to fit components, hides circuitry and prevents rendering and client syncing.
Does not allow light to penetrate.
message.block.tinyredstone.block_chopper: Crafts tiny blocks and camouflage circuit covers from most full-sized blocks. No silicon required!
tinyredstone.gui.repeater.msg2: Use buttons or scroll to set delay.
